name: Chickpea Flour Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: Chickpea Flour Chocolate Chip Cookies. Huge, chewy Cookies with chickpea flour. These cookies need 1 Bowl, are grain-free, gluten-free, vegan and can be made nut-free. Makes 7 to 8 large Cookies.
recipeIngredient: 1/3 cup oil (organic canola or safflower or extra virgin olive oil)
3/4 cup + 1 tbsp chickpea flour (garbanzo bean flour, or use Besan (gram flour) **)

recipeInstructions.text: Mix the flax seed meal and water and let it sit for 5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix the flax seed meal and water and let it sit for 5 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the rest of the wet ingredients and mix until the mixture is well combined. It will take a minute for the oil to incorporate.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the rest of the wet ingredients and mix until the mixture is well combined. It will take a minute for the oil to incorporate.

recipeInstructions.text: Add 3/4 cup flour and the rest of the dry ingredients and mix until the mixture is a stiff batter. Fold in the chocolate chips.Add as much chocolate as you like in chip or chunks or chopped.
recipeInstructions.name: Add 3/4 cup flour and the rest of the dry ingredients and mix until the mixture is a stiff batter. Fold in the chocolate chips.Add as much chocolate as you like in chip or chunks or chopped.

recipeInstructions.text: Refrigerate for at least an hour to overnight to chill. Check the mixture, if the mixture is too sticky or batter like, fold in another 1 to 3 tsp chickpea flour. *

recipeInstructions.text: Line the sheet with parchment. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F / 180ºc.
recipeInstructions.name: Line the sheet with parchment. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F / 180ºc.

recipeInstructions.text: Scoop the mixture on the baking sheet. I use a big spoon for large cookies and shape it loosely into a 1.5 inch ball. Sprinkle some coarse salt for salted chocolate chip cookies. Place on baking sheet atleast 2 inches away from each other. Bake for 12 to 13 minutes or until the cookies have spread and are starting to turn golden on the edges. Bake a minute longer for crunchier cookies.

recipeInstructions.text: Take the sheet out and slam lightly it on the counter to release the excess air from the cookies. **

recipeInstructions.text: Cool for 10 minutes, then remove from the sheet. cool for another few minutes before serving. The cookies are softer when warm and get chewier as they cool.
